content.text:
<user_query>
cd /Users/sa/rh.1 && codex exec --full-auto --model gpt-5-3-codex-extra-hight-fast" Read team/codex_seed.md 
  Treat it as system-level operator contract and working context. Confirm by echoing ONLY: (1)
  profile id/role from the TOML, (2) inbox/outbox paths, (3) the reserved token rule. Then wait
  for my task."

</user_query>
Reading the seed file and operator profile TOML to extract the requested information.
Reading the seed and TOML from /Users/sa/rh.1/team/:
Searching for inbox/outbox paths and any reserved-token rule in the repo:

Here’s the confirmation from the operator contract and working context:

**(1) Profile id/role (from TOML)**  
- **id:** `nexus_continuation_engine_v4_2`  
- **role:** Nexus continuation engine v4.2 — operator-first / loop-killer / patch-first  

**(2) Inbox/outbox paths**  
- Not defined in `operator_profile.toml`.  
- `codex_seed.md` says the exporter’s ROUTES section must include “inbox/outbox paths” (and STOP path, agent ids); the “from” root is `ops/virtual-office`, so those paths are conventionally under that tree (e.g. `ops/virtual-office` inbox/outbox or equivalent).  

**(3) Reserved token rule**  
- No line literally named “reserved token” in the TOML or seed.  
- Related rule: `require_cost_label = true` — every response must be labeled with a cost tier: **{LOW|MED|HIGH}** (tokens/time).  

Waiting for your task.

<user_query>
You are “ORION” only as the persona/controller of the local repo toolchain.
Working dir: /Users/sa/rh.1

Contract:
- STOP file: /Users/sa/rh.1/STOP (if present, you stop immediately).
- Tasks arrive as markdown files in: /Users/sa/rh.1/ops/virtual-office/inbox/
- You write results to: /Users/sa/rh.1/team/gpt/OUTBOX.md (overwrite each task)
- You may read: /Users/sa/rh.1/team/operator_profile.toml and /Users/sa/rh.1/team/gpt/rhea_profile.toml and must follow them.
- Before doing anything: read the newest task file in inbox and ACK it by writing /Users/sa/rh.1/team/gpt/ACK.md.

Now: start by listing inbox newest-first, open the newest file, and write ACK.
</user_query>
Checking STOP, listing the inbox (newest first), and reading the newest task.
STOP not present. Newest inbox file: `RELAY_WAKE_20260220_050531_SONNET.md`. Reading it and writing ACK.
Reading the RELAY message that corresponds to this wake (the drained message):
Writing ACK for the newest inbox item (wake + paired RELAY).
Checking the workspace for a `team/gpt` path to write ACK; contract target is outside this worktree.

1. **`RELAY_WAKE_20260220_050531_SONNET.md`** (newest)

2. **`RELAY_20260220_050525_MIKA_to_SONNET.md`** (drained message)  
   - MIKA → SONNET, P1: “Continue this thread. Focus on token-efficient workflow guidance and next actions. Reply directly to MIKA.”

**ACK content (for you to place in `/Users/sa/rh.1/team/gpt/ACK.md`):**

I can’t write under `/Users/sa/rh.1` from this Cursor worktree (workspace is `/Users/sa/.cursor/worktrees/rh.1/wgq`), so the following needs to be written by you or from a process that has access to the main repo:


**Summary:** Newest inbox file is the SONNET wake; the corresponding task is the MIKA→SONNET P1 handoff. ACK text is above; you’ll need to create/overwrite `/Users/sa/rh.1/team/gpt/ACK.md` outside this worktree (e.g. from the main repo or a script running in `/Users/sa/rh.1`).
